Authors:
H. Thorsten Lumbsch, Imke Schmitt, Ulrik Soechting, Roar S.
Poulsen
Title:
Molecular and morphological studies on the subantarctic genus
Orceolina (Agyriaceae).
Abstract:
The subantarctic genus Oresolina is revised and two
species are accepted, i.e.Â Orceolina antarctica (Mull. Arg.) R. S.
Poulsen & Sochting comb. nov. and Orceolina kerguelensis (Tuck.)
Hertel. Descriptions of the species are provided. In addition the
phylogeny of the genus Orceolina and allied taxa was investigated using
nucleotide sequences of the LSU rRNA gene. Sequences from these regions
of nine agyrialean fungi were aligned ro those of four representatives
of Pertusariales used as outgroup. The alignment was analysed
cladistically using maximum parsimony. The two Orceolina clustered
together within the Agyriaceae. The placement in the family is supported
by high bootstrap values and the Kishino-Hasegawa test.
